lines.quote: Do I frighten you?
Is it my scar?
It's your car.
Yeah, I know. I'm sorry. It's my mom's car.
Take a picture, it lasts longer.
What?
That table. Seems to keep them getting your attention.
Is that the girl from the billboard outside?
Yup.
She sure is a striking looking woman. Look at that hair.
Lots of leave-in conditioner.
Is that jealousy I detect?
Hardly. But if you wanna get with Jungle Julia, there's a real easy way to do that.
Yeah? And what would that be?
Get famous. You won't have to find her, she'll find you. And you don't even wanna know what she did for that billboard. Enjoy it cocksucker, you've earned it.
What did she ever do to you?

We went to school together, from kindergarten to high school, that's what she did to me. She was her height right now at twelve. She was a monster! Half the guy she still fucks from the old class she used to beat up and terrorize in the fifth grade.
And I see she used to beat you up and take your chocolate milk.
That pituitary case might've kicked my ass a couple of times... Sorry, I'm built like a girl and not a black man, but I'd die before I ever gave Julia Lucai my chocolate milk.
I was wondering if my friends and I could take the car out on our own just to see if we feel comfortable in it.
Why would I do something stupid like that?
To better sell your automobile.
How do I know you're not just gonna steal it?

Four reasons. One: we are not thieves. Two: that would be rude. Three: we are staying at the Day's Inn in town, you can check with them, we are registered for the next month. Well, Zoe's not, but Kim and I are so we are totally track-downable.
Who's Kim? The colored girl?
Yes, Kim would be the girl of color. And four, and most importantly, that will give you a chance to get to know our other friend, Lee.
She looks kinda familiar
That is because she is a famous movie star. We are making a Hollywood movie here in town
Why's she dressed like that?
Because it's a cheerleader movie and she's one of the cheerleaders.
What's a cheerleader movie?
A movie about cheerleaders.
Is it a porno?
*Yes*! But don't mention it. She's shy.
It's go go, not cry cry.
No... you can't go. Two against the world, remember?
There will be, I promise
I never miss.
I never miss.
Best in Texas.
Hey, hey. You want some barbeque? Best in Texas.
Oh, no thanks.
What's the matter? You don't eat meat?
Oh, I eat meat. I also eat lots of shit.
See that?
What's that?
Shit-eating grin.
You ought to be a comedian.
What do you think of the leg?
Sure is funny.
I was going to be a stand-up comedian.
If you... are thinking... of going... into... this house... DON'T!
Who do you want to hear?
Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.
Who?
Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.
Who the fuck are they?

For your information, Pete Townsend, at one point, almost quit The Who. And if he had, he would have ended up in this group, thus making it Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick, Tich and Pete. And if you ask me, he should have.

lines.stage: flips on the radio to hear "Hold Tight" by Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick & Tich

lines.quote: That's my boy!
Hey Warren, is there anybody in this place you could vouch for to give me a ride home?

lines.stage: tosses keys across table in front of Pam
lines.quote: Fair lady, your chariot awaits.
You've been eavesdropping?
Eavesdropping and can't help but hear, I think I belong in the latter category.
So, uh, "icy hot", you're offering me a ride home?
I'm offerin' you a lift, if, when I'm ready to leave, you are too.
And when are you thinking about leaving?
Truthfully, I'm not thinkin' about it. But when I do, you will be the first to know.
Will you be able to drive later?
I know looks can be deceiving, but I'm a teetotaler. I've been drinking club soda and lime all night, and now I'm buildin up to my big drink.
Which is what?
Virgin Pina Colada.
Okay. Why would someone who doesn't drink spend hours at a bar, drinking water?
You know, a bar offers all kinds of things other than alcohol.
Hmm, really. Like what?
Women. Nacho Grande platters. The fellowship of some fascinating individuals, like Warren here.
Fair enough. So what's your name, icy?
Stuntman Mike.
"Stuntman Mike's" your name?
You can ask anybody.
Hey Warren, who is this guy?
Stuntman Mike.
And who the hell is Stuntman Mike?
He's a stuntman.
So what's your name icy?
Stuntman Mike.
Stuntman Mike's your name.
You ask anybody.
Hey Warren, Who is this guy?
Stuntman Mike.
And who the hell is Stuntman Mike?
He's a Stuntman.
Where the hell are you going?
I'm going to get Cherry.
Fine, but we're taking my car.
I'm riding with you.

lines.stage: Kim and Zoe are convincing Abernathy to convince Jasper to take his 1970 Dodge Challenger for a test drive

lines.quote: What are you going to do? Blow him?
No!
I'm going to insinuate that Lee is.
Well Pam, which way you goin' left or right?
Right.
Aww, that's too bad.
Why?

Well, because there was a fifty-fifty shot on whether you'd be going left. You see, we're both going left. You could have just as easily been going left too and if that was the case, it would have been awhile before you started getting scared. But since you're going the other way, I'm afraid you're gonna have to start getting scared... immediately!

You know how people say, YOU'RE OKAY IN MY BOOK, or AND IN MY BOOK THAT'S NO GOOD. Well, I actually have... a book. And everybody I ever met goes in this book. And now I've met you, and... YOU'RE GOING IN THE BOOK TOO. Unfortunately, now I'm gonna have to file you under chicken... shit.

lines.stage: jumps up after being thrown from the hood of the car
lines.quote: I'm ok!
Don't shoot yourself. Don't shoot each other. And especially... don't shoot me.
That's my jacket. I looked for it for two weeks.
Did you find what was in the pocket?
Fuck no.
Look for it.
No, the other one.

lines.stage: searches through the other pocket and takes out a box with a ring inside it

lines.quote: I was gonna give it to you, but you left me. 'Cuz you took the jacket...
...and I looked for it for two weeks.
Read it.
Two against the world.
Remember that?
I never forgot it.

Look, you were being an unbelievable dick. I was walking out on you. I was cold, I took your fucking jacket. So, if you're go on one of your psycho, obsessive, controlling rants about a fucking jacket, then fucking take it 'cuz I'd rather fucking freeze than fucking hear about it one more time.
That boy's got the devil in him.
You like Ava Gardner?
Sorry?
Ava Gardner. D'you like her?
Yeah, I guess.
I was just thinkin' that you, uh, kinda look like Ava Gardner, a little bit.

lines.stage: stops elevator and turns back to Cherry
lines.quote: You have somethin' you wanna say to me?
I have nothing to say to you.
You have nothing to say to me? That's funny, cuz I could've sworn you just gave me a 'fuck you' look right now. You wanna say 'fuck you' to me?
Not at this moment.
You know what this is?
A gun.
It's simplicity itself. You see, you point it at what you want to die. And you pull the little trigger here. And a little bullet comes outta here.

lines.stage: presses gun barrel against Cherry's cheek

lines.quote: And the little bullet... hits you right there!
And you know what? You don't look like Ava Gardner no more.

lines.stage: grabs her hair as giant bubbles appear on his face
lines.quote: Do not taunt me, tramp. I am not one to be taunted. Say 'I got it'. SAY 'I GOT IT'!
I... got it.
Tool.
Give him the gun. Give him all the guns.
You carry a gun?
Uh-Huh.
Do you have a license to carry it?
Yeah, when I became a secret service agent, they gave me a license.
Oh, I didn't know you were... Ok. I didn't say it. Stop looking at me. I didn't say it. God! Did you know Kim carried a gun?
Yes. Yeah. Do I approve? No. Do I know? Yes.
I don't know what futuristic utopia you live in, but in the world I live in, a bitch need a gun.
You can't get around the fact that people who carry guns, tend to get shot more than people who don't.
And you can't get around the fact that if I go down to the laundry room in my building at midnight enough times, I might get my ass raped!
Don't do your laundry at midnight.
Fuck that! I wanna do my laundry whenever the fuck I want to do my laundry.
There are other things you can carry other then a gun. Pepper spray.
Uh, muthafucka tryin to rape me, I don't want to give him a skin rash. I wanna shot that nigga down!
How about a knife at least.

Yeah, you know what happens to muthafuckas who carry knives. They get shot! Look, if I ever become a famous actress, I won't carry a gun. I'll hire me a dude dirt nigga and he'll carry the gun, and when shit goes down, I'll sit back and laugh, but until that day, it's wild west muthafucka!
No more dead bodies for daddy tonight.
White meat, dark meat. All will be carved. THANKSGIVING.
Zoe, the motherfucking cat!
Why not just carry a knife instead of a gun?
You know what happens to mutha fuckers who carry knives? They get shot!
I'm gonna bust a nut up in this bitch right now!
I'm about to bust a nut up in this bitch, muthafucker!

lines.stage: speeding by a bunch of cows

lines.quote: Moo, muthafucker, moo!
I took a vow of peace. And now you want me to help you KILL these men?
Yes, bro... I mean Padre.
I'll see what I can do.

lines.stage: from segment Werewolf Women of the SS
lines.quote: Featuring Udo Kier, Sheri Moon Zombie, Tom Towles, Sybil Danning, Bill Moseley, and Nicolas Cage
as
Fu Manchu!
THIS IS MY MECCA! AHAHAHAHAHA! AHAHAHAHA!
God, dammit! Ramona, you've been fartin' like a goddamned pack mule.

But maybe a little later in the evening, you've had a few drinks, you're kind of losey gosey, you're safe with your girls. Then some kinda cute, kinda hot, kinda sexy, hysterically funny but not funny looking guy comes over and says it - then maybe you did it earlier and maybe you didn't.
Is anyone else here a bio-chemical engineer?
Oh you know I can't let you go...
Kim?
Not without tappin' that ass...
Umm Kim?
One... More... TIME!
Motherfucker try to rape me, I don't wanna give him a skin rash, I wanna shut that nigga down.
I'm Cherry.
You sure are.
We are now in total control of Pure Wolf!
I also want your balls.
I'll be your slave. I'll do anything you want... I'll even crack your back.
You'll do that anyways.
Yes, but this time, you won't even have to ask, you can just say "Bitch, do it" and I'll do it.
The woods are lovely dark and deep, and I have promises to keep and miles to go before I sleep. Did you hear me butterfly? Miles to go before you sleep.
And after this one... you'll never see me again.
Where's... the... shit?
I want you to open that for mommy. Can you?

lines.stage: he opens it, and there is a gun sitting inside

lines.quote: Take the gun.
Careful! That's it. And if anyone comes to the door that isn't me, I want you to shoot them. Okay? I'm not kidding Tony, you shoot them in the head.
What if it's dad?
ESPECIALLY if it's your dad.
The woods are lovely, dark, and deep.
And I've got promises to keep.
And miles to go before I sleep.
Did you hear that butterfly?
Miles to go before you sleep.
But they soon realize...
He's coming after *us*!

lines.stage: cut to Machete opening his jacket to reveal an arsenal of machetes

lines.quote: They just fucked with the wrong Mexican!
Alright, but you gotta take this recipe to the grave.
I think I can god damn guarantee that.
Never did like that son of a bitch. About as useless as a pecker on a pope.
So how exactly does one become a stuntman?

Well, in Hollywood, anyone fool enough to throw themselves down a flight of stairs can usually find someone to pay them for it. But really, I got into the business the way most people get into the stunt business.
How's that?
My brother got me in it.
Who's your brother?
Stuntman Bob.
You know some cultures might say he made the wiser choice.

Actually, we're paying you a compliment cause we're gonna do some stupid shit, but that's ok, cause we're stunt people, we ain't got good sense, but you've got good sense, and anybody with good sense ain't gonna wanna do what we're doin'.
You killed Bin Laden?
I put two in his heart, one in his computer.
So that was you.

lines.stage: as she beats Dakota's car with a shovel

lines.quote: Where do you think you're going, you fucking bitch?

I've seen me a lot of weird shit in my day, but I ain't never seen a one-legged stripper. I seen me a stripper with one breast. And I seen me a stripper with twelve toes. I've even seen me a stripper with no brains at all, but I ain't never seen a one-legged stripper. And I've been to Morocco.
How do you think they accomplish that?
CGI?

Well, nowadays unfortunately you're right more often than not. But back in the all or nothing days, the Vanishing Point days, the Dirty Mary Crazy Larry days, the White Line Fever days, they had real cars crashing into real cars and real dumb people driving em.
Get ready to fly, bitch!

lines.stage: as he rams into the Challenger
lines.quote: Hey, Abernathy, you wanna get hot? You wanna get hot? Suck on this for a while, bitch!
Name's Cherry Darling...
Sounds like a stripper name
No, it sounds like a go-go dancer name. There's a difference.
Now, what did you say after the last time?
Look, I know what I said...
What did you say?
I know I said we shouldn't do this again...
No! You didn't say we shouldn't, you said we ain't ever gonna do that again.
Yeah, but...

But, my ass! You said not only are we never gonna play "ships mast" again, but you also said that if you ever do what you're trying to do now, to not only refuse, but that I had permission to physically restrain your ass if necessary. Now, did you or did you not say that?
What...!
No, no, no, no! Answer the question, motherfucker! Did you or did you not say that?
Yes, I said that. However...
Whatever witch your however.
I like the way you say 'fuck'.
I'm the horniest motherfucker on the road!
Don't.
So what are you going to do now?
I'm going to be a stand-up comedian.
You're not funny
That's what I keep trying to tell everybody but they all say I'm hilarious
But you're not
There's a difference between being frank... and being dick.
But sometime earlier in the night I did have fuckability style, right?
Would you quit crying over fucking spilt milk?
I have no leg!
Hello sir! What's your name?
Jasper.
Hello Jasper, I'm Abernathy.
Aber- what?
Abernathy.
But what's your first name?
That is my first name.
What kind of first name is that?
You know what, why don't you just call me Abby.
Okay.
Hey good looking! We'll be back to pick you up later!
Gulp.
Yeah, yeah, Yeah! Jesus fucking christ... it's about time!
Get Lewis down here.
He's getting his dick wet, sir.
Get him the fuck down here... NOW!
I'm gonna eat your brains and gain your knowledge.
I want you to to take this gun, and if anyone comes to the door who's not me, I want you to shoot them. Shoot them in the head - just like in your video games.
Did you just hit a boat?
That's my jacket. I looked for that jacket for two weeks.
Oh, really, Wray? How long did you look for me?
The jacket belonged to me. You didn't.
So, how about that lapdance?
What's your name again?
Stuntman Mike.
Well, Stuntman Mike, I'm Butterfly. My friend Jungle Julia over here says that jukebox inside is pretty impressive.
Yeah, it is.
Yeah? Why don't you go get ready for your lapdance?

lines.stage: Stuntman Mike gets up and walks back into the bar

lines.quote: Hey, Mike.
Yeah?
No touch.
No.
I touch you, you don't touch me.
I know.
Good.
If you just stop right now, you know, and, and let me out, I'll never tell anybody...

Hey, Pam, remember when I said this car was death proof? Well, that wasn't a lie. This car is a hundred percent death proof. Only to get the benefit of it, honey, you REALLY need to be sitting in my seat.

lines.stage: slams his foot onto the brake and sends Pam flying face-first into his dashboard
as she beats Dakota's car with a shovel

lines.quote: We're gonna kill you!
Ladies, we're gonna have some fun.
You want the story? I'll spin it for you quick.
You gotta lose the arm, Joe.
Lose the arm? What do you mean, "lose the arm?" My arm?
There are few things fetching as a bruised ego on a beautiful angel.
Is that cowboy wisdom?
I'm not a cowboy, Pam. I'm a stuntman.

lines.stage: looking at a photo of Jungle Julia

lines.quote: You got a kiss for me, my girlfriend?
You best get yo' ass off Kim's car.
I've seen Kim sit on it before.
Her ass ain't yo' ass.
I'm gettin' my dick wet.
She's only got one leg.
Easier access.
Oh... that is a good point.
You a doctor?
Hm. I was earlier tonight.
I always wanted to be a doctor, instead, I can do this. Useless talent number 66. I'm very pliable.
You know my girlfriend had a theory, she said that you find a use for every useless talent you ever had.
I'm not that optimistic. I feel like I'm stuck a drain and I can't get out.
She'd say, "when you're stuck in that spiral, just reach up".
What if there's nothing up there?
Just reach up.
You're a dancer.
I was earlier tonight.
Well I'm pulling you out of retirement!
Where are my men?

lines.stage: throws a bag to Lt. Muldoon
lines.quote: I put several right here.
What the fuck is this?
Their balls, sweetheart.

lines.stage: Abby is being held down around some severed testicles

lines.quote: Looks like I got you by the balls, Abby.
You certainly have.
You'll come home for the holidays... in a body bag.
Please, Father. Have mercy.
God has mercy. I don't.
If you're going to hire Machete to kill the bad guy, you'd better make damn sure the bad guy isn't you!

lines.stage: Machete trailer: Machete walks the streets

lines.quote: They called him Machete.
Seventy dollars a day for yard work. Hundred for roofing.

lines.stage: car with The Boss pulls up

lines.quote: Get in.

lines.stage: cut to Machete in car with The Boss

lines.quote: One-twenty-five for septic... sewage.
Have you ever killed anyone before?

lines.stage: Machete trailer: Machete sharpens a machete

lines.quote: He knows the score...

lines.stage: cut to The Boss picking up a phone

lines.quote: Where are my wife and daughter?

lines.stage: cut to Machete in a pool with The Boss's wife and daughter

lines.quote: He gets the women!

lines.stage: Tasting the blood from the decapitated turkey mascot
lines.quote: It's blood.
Son of a bitch!
